questions.question_text:
A company is evaluating the functionality of Dynamics 365 finance and operations apps.

The company wants to display multiple master data records to add, delete, and update the data.

You need to recommend the type of form to use to display the master data.

Which form type should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
Should be List.
It should be A list form.
Purchase orders can be managed also in D365 Finance, under "Account payable" module. So the first answer is Yes.

The answer is Yes to both questions. 
First Question Reason:
https://ellipsesolutions.com/dynamics-365-for-finance-and-operations-focusing-on-purchase-order-returns/
Option 1: 
Open the **original** Purchase order used to procure the item. Yeah, you can maintain a Purchase order even after it has been received and invoiced. The link between the original purchase and the return is forever captured. Enter the item number of the item to be *returned* along with the quantity being *returned*, but with a *minus* sign in front of the quantity.
Question states clearly the company uses D365 Finance. There is no purchase order or return order function in Finance! It is only in Supply Chain! Trick question. I believe the first answer is No.

Purchase order to return order and purchase return order are 2 are two completely different things.
It's False.
Correct Answer is :
-No
-Yes

Correct.
"The first step is to create a new purchase order to be used as the purchase return order."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/procurement/tasks/create-purchase-return-order
I think it should be a purchase return order, not a purchase order (please refer to URL)

comments.content:
On the link https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/procurement/tasks/create-purchase-return-order 
Says: to Create a new purchase return order The first step is to create a new purchase order to be used as the purchase return order." so I think its Yes, you can use a purchase orden to create a purchase return order.

questions.question_text:
A company creates a project plan in Dynamics 365 Project Operations.

The project plan must allow a project manager to:

• Track profitability,
• Collaborate on the work to be performed, and
• Allocate people to perform tasks.

You need to identify the project derivatives that the project plan must track.

Which three major project derivatives should the plan track? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Project Operations for services operations.

The company needs to estimate the full-time resources required to complete different tasks for a new project.

You need to identify which feature should be used for the requirement.

Which feature should you use?

discussion.content:
The question is ambigious. If the requirement is to estimate the cost of full-time resources requried to complete the project tasks, then yes, WBS is correct, because planned hours can be allocated to tasks in the WBS and this, in turn, can be used to calcualte resource costs -> https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/create-a-work-breakdown-structure-of-tasks-for-a-project

If the requirement is simply estimate the no. of full-time resources that are required to complete the project tasks, then resource utlization will be correct.

The questions need to be more clear.

It should be D resource utilization. 
Work Breakdown Structure (WBS): The WBS is a hierarchical breakdown of project tasks.
While it doesn’t directly handle resource estimates, it provides the structure for organizing tasks and understanding their dependencies.
